{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the latest immunization schedule for an un-immunized 13 months old child. According to the article '[New vaccines]', the schedule for active immunization of normal infants and children in the routine strategy has been reviewed, and some new vaccines have been defined. The schedule should be based on this review. Furthermore, considering the extent of occurrence of six vaccine preventable diseases in vaccinated/unvaccinated children, we need to follow the recommended vaccination schedule. According to the article '[Vaccination in childhood]', all children should be immunized against diphtheria and tetanus. For poliomyelitis oral vaccination is necessary.
